articles.content:
Films Screened to Mark DPRK Founding Anniversary 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Documentary and feature films are being screened at cinemas and cultural houses across the country to celebrate the 56th birthday of the DPRK. The films deal with the undying feats of the peerlessly great persons for the founding of the DPRK and its strengthening and development and with the struggle of the Korean people in this course.
 Among them are "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Gives On-site Guidance to Different Fields" and "Bringing About a Great Turn by Songun Revolutionary Leadership" and other documentaries. "The Birth of a New Government", "Bright Morning" and "My Country" are feature films telling about the founding of the people's power in the DPRK and its glorious course. There are also such feature films as "One Day before Liberation", "The Wind in the Year 1941", "The Untrodden Path" and "Fortress".

Greetings to Brazilian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Brazilian Foreign Minister Celso Luis Nunes Amorim on the independence day of the country.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop more favorably in the future.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Brazilian President
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message to President Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva on Tuesday, congratulating him on the independence day of the Federative Republic of Brazil.
 The message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of its people, expressing the expectation and belief that the favorably developing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.

DPRK Officials Visit Russian Embassy
    Pyongyang, September 7 (KCNA) -- Officials of the DPRK ministries of Foreign Affairs, Railways, Foreign Trade and Forestry and the Korea-Russia Friendship Association visited the embassy of the Russian Federation here Tuesday to express condolences over the death of many innocent people in a hostage-taking incident caused by terrorists in Russia.
 Visitors made entries in the mourner's book.
